title: IBM Cloud overview docs
introduction: The platform is built to support your needs whether it's working only in the public cloud or taking advantage of a multicloud deployment model. Leverage the docs, API & SDK reference, architecture references, and more to support your app development needs.

section_recommended.title: What's included in the platform?
section_recommended.description: The platform consists of a network of interrelated components that work together to provide a consistent and dependable cloud experience to support your app development needs.

section_recommended.title: Try out IBM Cloud, for free
section_recommended.description: Get up and running quickly by setting up a Lite account with this short tutorial.

section_recommended.title: Service and infrastructure by location
section_recommended.description: Check out the regions and data centers that IBM Cloud products are available.

section_videos.title: Learn how to navigate through the IBM Cloud console

tiles.title: Support for third-party Operator bundles from Red Hat OpenShift registries
tiles.description: Third-party providers can now onboard Operator bundles from Red Hat OpenShift registries to IBM Cloud. The Red Hat OpenShift registries include Certified Operators, Marketplace Operators, and community Operators. This capability is supported by the beta release of IBM Cloud Partner Center and our general availability release of private catalog capabilities.

tiles.title: New invitation flow for existing IBM Cloud users
tiles.description: From June 1, 2021, to enhance security and user protection, IBM Cloud requires all users to accept an invitation in order to become an active user within a new account. Concerned about how this change impacts your automation? To avoid any disruption to on-going workflows, you need to check your scripts.

tiles.title: Support for third-party virtual server images with Terraform
tiles.description: Third-party providers can now offer virtual server images deployed by using Terraform in IBM Cloud. This capability is supported by the beta release of IBM Cloud Partner Center and our previously general availability release of private catalog capabilities.
